title: v0.14.7 crashes on Arm64

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
- what happened: Syncthing automatically updated from 14.6 to 14.7 on an Arm64 SOC and now syncthing won't start/crashes whenever I try to start version 14.7 (see log file below).
- what you expected to happen instead: I expected this update to start normally like all the other versions
- any steps to reproduce the problem: I downgraded to 14.6 and everything runs normally. I updated to 14.7 through the GUI and the same issue happens (see log file below). I rebooted and downgraded again to 14.6 and everything runs normally. I manually installed 14.7 from CLI and the same issue happens again. I have once again downgraded to 14.6 and will be running 14.6 until the issue can be resolved. Thanks for your help.
### Version Information

---

Syncthing Version: v0.14.7
OS Version: 
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="8"
VERSION="8 (jessie)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="http://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"

Board: Odroid C2
Processor: Arm64 -> Amlogic ARM® Cortex®-A53(ARMv8) 1.5Ghz quad core CPUs

Browser Version: n/a
## Log Output
